RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 75. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 19000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $16,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000 AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 9 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 9 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAINE was allowed to settle early, came wide into the lane, closed well on the outside to get up in time, driving. MIZZEN MONEY chased the early pace and made a four wide bid off the turn and gained the lead at the sixteenth marker but was caught late to just miss. SUPER ROCKER was reserved early, angled in leaving the seven sixteenths, advanced on the inside on the turn, came two wide off the turn and finished well but needed more. NEON SIGN was away alertly and dueled for the lead and made a two wide bid leaving the turn to shake clear, but faded in the furlong grounds. FREEDOM'S START chased the pace and was three wide on the urn but lacked the needed stretch bid. SON OF A BEAST dueled for the lead on the inside and weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Freedom's Start
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace, 3 wide turn, needed stretch bid

ENTRY.NAME: Maine
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, came wide upper, closed outside, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Son of a Beast
ENTRY.OWNER: J A G Racing and Jettany Thoroughbred Corp.
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled inside, weakened stretch,

ENTRY.NAME: Super Rocker
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, inside move turn, shift 2 wide, finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Mizzen Money
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 4 wide, bid 4 wide, led between calls, caught, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Neon Sign
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2 wide, bid 2 wide, faded 1/8

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 2 5F Turf CR: 72. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 18000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $16,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000 AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non -winners Of A Race Since May 9 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed inadvisable by managemen t to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five Furlongs.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BROTHER SHOWTYME was settled early, made a four wide move off the turn, continued that move to get up in time under a drive. KNOCKDOWN KID stalked the early pace and made a three wide bid off the turn to gain a short lead by the furlong marker, then ran on but was caught late to just miss. CHIEF REIDER tracked the pace on the inside, checked leaving the three eighths, then made a inside bid off the turn but was out kicked. POLSAR was settled early, five wide by the quarter pole and had a mild late rally, needed more. LITTLE J P set the pace and was on the inside on the turn and faded the final furlong. ZOOMSTER broke in the air and was not a factor. UNCLE REMI showed brief speed between rivals and stopped, raced with no front shoes.

ENTRY.NAME: Chief Reider
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, checked 3/8, bid inside, out kicked

ENTRY.NAME: Zoomster
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in air, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Brother Showtyme
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, 4 wide upper, closed, up, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Polsar
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 5 wide 1/4 pole, mild rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Uncle Remi
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief speed between horses, stopped, no front shoes

ENTRY.NAME: Knockdown Kid
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 3 wide, bid 3 wide, caught, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Little J P
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, inside turn, faded 1/8

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 85. Claiming Purse 16400. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 9 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 9 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, if for $9,000, al lowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAGIC SPIN was rated early, made a four wide move nearing the quarter pole, then battled in the stretch and edged clear to prove best, driving. BOX OF CHOCOLATES was rated on the inside and made a bid between rivals leaving the turn to vie for command but was outfinished. FED CHAIR set a pressured pace on the inside, shook clear on the turn, then was headed by the quarter pole, battled to the furlong marker and faded. KEFI was reserved early, made a inside move on the turn but flattened out in the lane. LAST MINUTE MARIO bumped at the start, pressed the pace two wide and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Fed Chair
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace inside, shook clear turn, headed 1/4, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Kefi
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, inside move turn, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Last Minute Mario
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, pressed pace 2 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Box of Chocolates
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated inside, bid between horses upper, dueled, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Magic Spin
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated 3 wide, 4 wide move turn, edged clear late, driving,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 4 1 1/16M Turf CR: 89. Allowance Purse 28000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR PENNSYLVANIA BRED. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since May 9 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since April 9 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at One Mile and One Sixteenth.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FIFTY SHEAS OFGREY was away alertly to set the pace on the inside, drew clear on the turn and then drew off smartly in the lane to prove much the best, driving. SAKETUMI prompted the winner two wide and fell back nearing the quarter pole and proved to be no match for that rival, clearly second best. MEAN MACHINE was settled early, came three wide into the lane and bested the rest. CALL ON CLARA was taken back early, advanced on the turn three wide and came four wide into the lane but had no late rally. EYE OF GUNFIGHTER was reserved on the inside and lacked a rally, raced with no front shoes.. EGOT A POKER FACE chased the pace on the inside and tired. LAKE NAKURU showed no speed and was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Lake Nakuru
ENTRY.COMMENT: void early speed, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Eye of Gunfighter
ENTRY.OWNER: Hickory Made Stables and Celtic Venture Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved inside, lacked rally

ENTRY.NAME: Fifty Sheas Ofgrey
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pace inside, drew clear turn, drew off stretch,

ENTRY.NAME: Egot a Poker Face
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace inside, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Mean Machine
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, came 3 wide upper stretch, bested rest

ENTRY.NAME: Call On Clara
ENTRY.COMMENT: taken back, came 4 wide upper stretch, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Saketumi
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace 2 wide, no match, 2nd best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 5 1M Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 11800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since May 9 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since April 9 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $5 ,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ADY'S MUNNY set a pressured pace two wide early, drew clear on the turn and then drew off in the stretch to prove much the best, driving. PRATT was rated early, four wide on the backstretch, then advanced three wide on the turn and got the place award. MR BOLDACIOUS was four wide into the first turn, five wide on the backstretch, made a four wide run on the turn and flattened out, bested rest. SALTY HEIR was rated between rivals on the backstretch, then was on the inside on the far turn and weakened. LONG TOM was settled back early, came six wide into the lane and had no rally. TYLER TIME stalked the early pace and made a mild bid three wide early and then was two wide on the turn and tired. INNUENDO pressed the pace on the inside and stopped.

ENTRY.NAME: Long Tom
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled back, came 6 wide, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Innuendo
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace inside, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Salty Heir
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated between horses, inside 2nd turn, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Tyler Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 3 wide, bid 3 wide 1/2, 2 wide turn, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Pratt
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated, 4 wide backstretch, 3 wide turn, got place

ENTRY.NAME: Ady's Munny
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace 2 wide, drew clear turn, drew off stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Boldacious
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4 wide first turn, settled, 5 wide 1/2, 4 wide 1/4, flattened out

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 15400. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 9 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 9 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,00 0, if for $9,000, allowed 2 lbs.

CLAIM.OWNER: Two Ten Twelve Triple T Racing

RACE.FOOTNOTES: MORE RANSOM tracked the early pace three wide, made a four wide bid off the turn and edged away in the furlong grounds to prove best, driving. SWEET TALIA dueled for the lead and made a three wide bid to shake clear of the turn, but then was confronted by the winner leaving the furlong marker and could no match strides with that rival late, second best. UNION RALLY dueled for the lead on the inside and weakened in the drive. WE'LL SEE tracked the pace on the inside and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: We'll See
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace inside, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Union Rally
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled inside, weakened stretch,

ENTRY.NAME: More Ransom
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 3 wide, bid 4 wide, edged away, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet Talia
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 3 wide, bid 3 wide, clear 3/16, headed, 2nd best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 7 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 78. Claiming Purse 10000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE DECEMBER 9. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BEYOND THE BEND was rated along the inside, advanced on the turn and was blocked leaving the turn, waited patiently, angled out nearing the furlong marker and split rivals and drew clear to prove best under confident handling. DROSSELMOON vied for the lead and made a inside bid leaving the turn to gain a short advantage but then not go with the winner late, held place award. COAST TO COAST vied for the lead on the outside, made a four wide bid but flattened out, missed place award. KING'S HOUSE tracked the pace three wide, made a four wide move onb the turn and a five wide bid off the turn but hung late. TRUE GOLD vied for the lead between rivals and faded the final furlong. WHO YOU SAY I AM was settled on the inside and had no rally.

ENTRY.NAME: Who You Say I Am
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, saved ground turn, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Beyond the Bend
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated inside, blocked upper stretch, angled, split 1/8, handily

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: WMT Stables, Inc & Sylmar Farms, Inc

ENTRY.NAME: Drosselmoon
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead inside, bid upper, no match, held place

ENTRY.NAME: King's House
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 3 wide, 4 wide turn, bid 5 wide upper, hung

ENTRY.NAME: True Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead, between horses turn, faded 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Coast to Coast
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead outside, bid 4 wide, flattened out, missed 2nd
